main event: Three unidentified objects were observed in the sky over Carrollton, Ohio on July 1, 1956, for a duration of approximately 3 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were described as being rather strange in appearance and maneuver,The witness indicated the objects appeared to hover, then dart off in different directions at a high rate of speed,The color of the objects was noted to be a bright reddish orange when visible,The sighting was evaluated as mostly unknown phenomena with some being suggested as aircraft or astronomical objects,There were multiple witnesses, including S.E. Cornforth, who reported the observation thoroughly.
witness description: witnesses included S.E. Cornforth and two others
